results.title: Silent speech (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A study of non-verbal communication in young children featuring the work of biologist Prof. Hubert Montagner who has discovered a correlation between the behavior of children and the attitudes of the mother toward the child. He also suggests that physiological changes in the mother - specifically the level of various hormones - are mirrored in the child. Made by British Boradcasting Corporation.

results.title: Silent Shakespeare
results.brief_description: In Silent Shakespeare, film historian Luke McKernan showcases a compilation of extracts from early film adaptations of the Bard’s more regularly performed plays. Sourced from nitrate prints in the National Film and Television Archive Collection, these extracts are unique for revealing the growing enthusiasm for, and enchantment with, the new medium. Film was initially viewed as the poor cousin of theatre. To combat its reputation of being cheap entertainment for the lower classes, film sought to emulate the highbrow success of the theatre by replicating its lavish venues, poaching its stars for screen roles, and adapting plays into films. Working within the limitations of early film cameras and the staginess of Shakespeare’s works, many of the early productions were hybrids between stage and screen, juxtaposing constructed sets and stage-like tableaux with location shooting, trick photography, hand stencilling, and colour tinting. Works included are King John (Great Britain, 1899), the first ever film adaptation of Shakespeare; The Tempest (Great Britain, 1908); A Midsummer night’s dream (USA, 1909); King Lear (Italy, 1910); Twelfth night (USA, 1910); The Merchant of Venice (Italy, 1910), and Richard III (Great Britain, 1911).

results.title: Silent safari: lion
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the lion as he eats, sleeps and plays with female and cubs in his natural habitat. Also shows lions living together in prides, and hunting wild beasts such as antelope, zebra, buffalo or giraffe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Shows without commentary the lion as he eats, sleeps and plays with female and cubs in his natural habitat. Also shows lions living together in prides, and hunting wild beasts such as antelope, zebra, buffalo or giraffe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Silent pioneers
results.brief_description: Through intimate profiles eight men and women, this film offers a portrait of the 3.5 million gay and lesbian elders in the USA. Contrary to the public stereotype of a youthful homosexual community, gay men and lesbians do grow old. This is a portrait of strong and active women and men who face not only issues of ageing, but also concerns related to sexual orientation. This film intimately profiles eight men and women

results.title: Silent passages
results.brief_description:
Silent Passages is based around photographs taken of the World War 2 tunnels under the Darwin and inspired by the kind of fantasy storytelling used in games such as Riven and Myst. In the words of the artist “We find a man alone at the entrance to a tunnel. He enters. The labyrinth before him, a reminder of a past long gone. Eerie sounds are triggered as he passes from chamber to chamber and nothing appears as it seems. His story is hidden beneath a mask of time and decay.
Silent Passages is a legend within a story. Two parallel journeys fused by a lover, and torn apart by the betrayal of war.” Soundtrack is “Music for Guitar and Shakuhachi” by Andrew MacGregor and Marion Schaap.

results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Hugh Burton, Jamie Blanks and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.

results.title: Silent Night: Story of a Christmas carol
results.brief_description: Dramatises the story of how “Silent Night” was originally written. Beginning with a wandering group pf American carollers, the story slips back to Austria in 1818. In the little town of Aberndof, Father Mohr, the vilalge priest, was struck with the beauty of Cristmas Eve and wrote a Christmas poem. His friends, Franz Gruber, the teacher-choirmaster, composed musisc for the poem and the song spread over Austria until it became a Christmas carol, popular in every corner of the globe.

results.title: Silent night with Jose Carreras
results.brief_description: During a stay in Salzburg for the Salzburg festival, Jose Carreras discovered the chapel where “Silent night” was first played by Gruber and Mohr. Produced on location in the winter-wonderland of Oberndorf, Jose Carreras is the first opera singer to present this famous Christmas carol from the original setting. He also performs other famous Christmas songs, including “White Christmas”, “Ave Maria” and “Adeste fideles”, his tenor voice creating magic for listeners of every age.

results.title: Silent night holy night
results.brief_description: Warning- there is an image drop out 30 seconds into tape, preceding the title. The church organ is in need of repair with only two days to go until Christmas. If the organ is not fixed the choir will have to sing unassisted, and the music wouldn’t sound right. The organ player makes the journey with his children to buy the part but are unable to return with it when they must abandon their car in an avalanche. As the priest reflects on the silent night in the absence of an organ, words come to him that will be familiar to everyone. An entertaining story on how one of the world most famous carols may have evolved. Featuring the beautiful voices of the Oberndorf Boys’ Choir.

results.title: Silent movie
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Crossbow, Michael Hertzberg and Mel Brooks
results.brief_description: Only one word of dialogue, (spoken by Marcel Marceau), in this Mel Brooks satire. Brooks portrays a director who comes up with a radical idea to save an ailing movie studio. He and his cronies band together to make a silent movie. Filled with slapstick gags reminiscent of the original silent classics, “Silent movie” features cameo appearances from a star studded cast including Mel Brooks, Marty Feldman, Dom DeLuise, Sid Caesar and Bernadette Peters.
